text:
A member of the bomb disposal squad defusing an improvised explosive device in the Lasjan area of Srinagar on Friday.- PHOTO: NISSAR AHMAD

A suspected improvised explosive device (IED) was detected by security forces at Lasjan on the Panthachowk-Parimpora stretch of the Srinagar bypass road on Friday, the police said.

A patrol party of security forces detected a suspicious object by the roadside at Lasjan and summoned the bomb disposal squad, a police official said. The bomb disposal squad carried out a controlled explosion to destroy the object, he said.

The traffic on the busy highway was suspended but restored after the bomb disposal squad finished its task, he said.

Meanwhile, in another incident, militants hurled a grenade at a CRPF bunker in Pulwama district, creating panic but no damage was done in the explosion, police said.

The grenade landed on the road and exploded without causing any damage. — PTI
title: Explosive detected on J&K road defused
